title: 'Keen Poster
summary:
Posters are items used in base building. There are a variety of patterns, all with the same blueprint formula.

The poster pictured here uses the standard Alphabet to display the phrase "Keen as a bean for Vykeen".
game_description: Self-adhesive, crease-proof wall art.
source_info: Blueprint can be purchased from the Construction Research Station for 1 Salvaged Data.
release_history: * Frontiers - added as a base-building component.

title: Access Ramp
summary:
Access Ramp is a Base building structure used to facilitate entry into a building from the outside.

The ramp's preview auto-snaps to existing ramps and to the bottom edges of Doors, Holo-Doors and Watertight Doors.
game_description: A reinforced, non-ferrous ramp to provide access to buildings.
release_history: * Pathfinder - This item was added as a base-building component.
additional_info: *The blueprint for Access Ramp is learned from a Blueprint Analyser.

title: Adjustable Chair
summary:
Adjustable Chair is a base building product and can be found in the Decoration/Interior Decoration building category.

The blueprint is acquired from the Construction Research Unit or Construction Research Station.
game_description: A comfortable chair designed to accommodate most bipedal races, with only mild numbing of the posterior.
release_history:
* NEXT - Blueprint changed.
* Frontiers - Renamed, formerly "Chair".

title: Agricultural Specialist's Room
summary: '''Agricultural Specialist's Room''' is a Freighter Base Building module accomodating Farmer terminal.
game_description:
Integrated freighter research equipment tailored to the needs of farmers, and equipped for the analysis and cultivation of farmable crops.

This module is placed as an entire room and comes with its functional units pre-installed.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a technology

title: Agricultural Terminal
summary:
The Agricultural Terminal is a hydroponic farming research.

Farmer. These NPCs can be recruited in Space stations within Gek controlled systems.

Seeds/DNA/blueprints for the following items can be acquired at an Agricultural Terminal, based on specific quests from the Farmer. The crop produced by each plant follows in parenthesis.
game_description:
thumb|Agricultural terminal
A research station tailored to the needs of Farmers, and equipped for the analysis and cultivation of farmable crops.
release_history:
* Foundation - Added as a base building product.
* Atlas Rises - Solanium required to unlock the blueprint for the Agricultural Terminal.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Iron.
* Visions - Gek Charm no longer needed to begin production of the terminal
additional_info:
* The blueprint for an Agricultural Terminal is acquired after completing the first few quests from the Construction Terminal.
* It can be built in a Cylindrical Room, a Square Room, or a Cuboid Room, and each terminal related to Hirable NPCs needs to be placed in a separate room.

title: Albumen Pearl Orb
summary: Albumen Pearl Orb seeds can be acquired from a hired Farmer, or purchased from the Construction Research Station in the Space Anomaly for 3 Salvaged Data.
game_description:
A medium-sized, farmable Crystal Orb that yields an occasional harvest of valuable Albumen Pearls.

Suitable for hydroponic indoor planting. Cannot be planted outdoors.

Approximate growing time: 2 hours
release_history:
* Foundation - Added as a product.
* NEXT 1.55 - Growing time changed, formerly it was 80 minutes.
additional_info: * Growing the plant will produce 1 Albumen Pearl in roughly 2 hours of real time.

title: Alliance of Galactic Travellers Decal
summary:
Decals are decoration items used in base building. There are a variety of patterns, all with the same blueprint formula.

This decal is a visual representation of the Alliance of Galactic Travellers logo.
game_description:
thumb|Decal in use
An exclusive placeable decal, to add flair and decoration to bases.

This decal represents the Alliance of Galactic Travellers, and the value of nomadic exploration.
release_history: * Expeditions - added as a base-building component.
additional_info: * It was made available following its unlocking during the community event mission which completed on 17-Apr-2021 (AGT Stardate 3737.17.4) which was also coincidentally the date of the AGT Fourth Anniversary celebrations.

title: Alloy Arch
summary:
Alloy Arch is a Base building structure used to erect basic structures.

The basic component's preview auto-snaps to the edges of other basic components.
game_description:
Reinforced Alloy building module, widespread in basic structures across the galaxy.

Conforms to Universal Building Standards 2.3b, ensuring maximum compatibilty with other prefab structurs. Rapid Grid snapping allows for quick assembly of custom shelter layouts
release_history: * Frontiers - This item was added as a base-building component.
additional_info: *The blueprint is learned from a Construction Research Unit, or Construction Research Station.

title: Alternative Landing Pad
summary:
thumb|Alternative Landing Pad on the ground
Alternative Landing Pad is a base building product that provides a platform where starships can land and take off. This includes not only the player's ship, but also NPC traders. 

* Players may call their ship to a alternative landing pad using Navigation Data.
* Taking off from a landing pad has no Launch Thruster cost.
* When constructing an alternative Landing Pad, they cannot be attached to buildings directly and can only be place on top of the planet surface or floor parts such as Concrete Floor Panel, Wood Floor Panel and Metal Floor Panel.
* Starships will be placed upon available landing pads when teleporting back to the player’s base.
* NPC starships may land on landing pads.
game_description: A stable, reinforced landing pad for starships.
release_history:
* Waypoint - Recipe changed, previously used 25 carbon.
* Frontiers - Introduced to the game.
additional_info:
* The blueprint is acquired from the Construction Research Station for 1 Salvaged Data.
* Landing craft will be oriented with the instrument boxes and the angled corner to their right.
*

Decals are decoration items used in base building. There are a variety of patterns, all with the same blueprint formula.

This decal represents the Amino Hub, and the principles of community, adventure and discovery.
release_history: * Expeditions - added as a base-building component.

title: Ancient Conifer
summary: Ancient Conifer is an item used in base building.
game_description:
This tree lives on an almost geological time scale.  Low heat and light levels in their native habitat restrict growth to mere millimeters each season.  A sample this size is a botanical marvel.

Provides decorative landscaping opportunities for bases.
additional_info: The blueprint can be purchased from the Quicksilver Synthesis Companion in the Space Anomaly for 500

title: Anomaly Decal
summary: Decals are decoration items used in base building. There are a variety of patterns, all with the same blueprint formula.
game_description:
An exclusive placeable decal, to add flair and decoration to bases.

This decal depicts Traveller Anomaly.
release_history: * NEXT 1.58 - added as a base-building component.

title: Antimatter Reactor
summary:
Antimatter Reactor is a base salvage capsule and the only way to differentiate the two is selecting them.

It does not consume any power in the base.
game_description:
An autonomous baryogenesis reactor, this device can be left to harvest reality paradoxes and convert them into usable antimatter. User must monitor fuel levels to ensure continued operation.

The resulting antimatter is safely contained, ready for use in all standard hyperspace power units.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from the Construction Research Station aboard the Space Anomaly.
release_history: * Beyond - Added as a base building product.
additional_info:
* This building is only available in the build menu if you are on a base, making it impossible to be built on a freighter.
*The Barrel Fabricator is another source of antimatter which doesn't require any refueling.  However, its output is completely random and takes much, much longer to generate output.

title: Apollo Decal
summary: Decals are decoration items used in base building. There are a variety of patterns, all with the same blueprint formula.
game_description:
An exclusive placeable decal, to add flair and decoration to bases.

This decal depicts the Traveller Apollo.
release_history: * NEXT 1.58 - added as a base-building component.

title: Appearance Modifier
summary: Appearance Modifier is a bases or within player-owned freighters as Appearance Modifier Rooms
game_description:
A buildable module that allows the users to adjust their personal appearance settings.

The module applies advanced holographic techniques to recalibrate the light around the user, allowing them to adopt whatever appearance they desire. Visual data must be properly formated before use.
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as product.
* Desolation - custom banner icons, colors, and titles added.
* Echoes - Autophage race added.
additional_info:
* In a new game the appearance of the player character is defaulted to an Anomaly.
* Since the Appearance Modifier states that it merely changes the outside look of the player through holographic projections, rather than changing their species or DNA, all players could still be considered part of the Anomaly race even when they take the appearance of another species.
* Camera View can be toggled between first-person and third-person to see the avatar.
* Power consumption is 50kP.
* Some special NPC head customisations can only be unlocked via save editing.
* The Autophage race has been added to the customiser in the Echoes update, and must be unlocked through a questline.

title: Appearance Modifier Room
summary: Appearance Modifier Room is a Freighter Base Building module replacing Appearance Modifier.
game_description:
Integrated freighter equipment allowing the user to adjust their personal appearance settings. This module is placed as an entire room and comes with its functional units pre-installed.

The module applies advanced holographic techniques to recalibrate the light around the user, allowing them to adopt whatever appearance they desire. Visual data must be properly formatted before use.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a technology

title: Aquatic Crystal
summary: Aquatic Crystal is an item used in base building. It is a tall flowering light-producing plant.
game_description: An eye-catching cluster of crystallised oceanic minerals. These crystals grow in a shard-like structure, and feature an unusual marbled colouration.
release_history: * Abyss - added as a base-building component
additional_info: The blueprint can be purchased from the Quicksilver Synthesis Companion in the Space Anomaly for 500

title: Archaic Habitation Heater
summary: Archaic Habitation Heater is a customisation part available from the Quicksilver Synthesis Companion.
game_description:
Although primitive in design, this habitation heater is nonetheless a popular home furnishing.  Its hypnotic flames and gentle crackling lend a comforting ambience to any room.

Provides interior decoration opportunities for bases.
release_history: * Expeditions - Introduced following as a Community Research reward.

title: Auto Switch
summary: Auto Switch is a base building product that is used to toggle power to buildings using Electrical Wiring.
game_description:
A power management device, this switch will toggle the flow of power when signaled by an incoming signal.

Switches require both power and signal wires to control a device.
additional_info:
* The blueprint can be acquired from the Construction Research Station on the Space Anomaly for Salvaged Data.
* The product has a 3rd socket/control socket that is located in the middle of the product (or at the bottom if the product is placed vertically on a wall). The socket needs to be powered together with an input socket for this product to supply power to the output socket.

title: Automated Feeder
summary: Automated Feeder is a base building product. It requires power to operate.
game_description:
thumb|Automated Feeder in the wild
A robotic bait tanks full in order to supply lifeforms with desired food.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from the Construction Research Station on the Space Anomaly for 10 Salvaged Data.
release_history:
* Beyond 2.09.1 - Tweaked the UI for the Agricultural Robot.
* Origins - Blueprint changed, previously used Oxygen Filter.
additional_info:
* Works in combination with the Livestock Unit for a fully automated feeding and harvesting cycle.
* Power consumption is 20kP
*Limited to ten (10) Automated Feeders per base.

title: Autonomous Mining Unit
summary: Autonomous Mining Unit is a base building product used to increase the efficiency of mining resources. It can extract the planet's Resource Deposits without the need for constant supervision and without depleting them.
game_description:
thumb|Empty and Full AMU

An automated harvester for the mining of resources. Once activated, the AMU extracts minerals without the need for supervision, providing a regular yield until the site is exhausted.
release_history:
*Foundation - Added as a base building product.
*NEXT 1.63 - Fixed an issue that caused the AMU to mine an incorrect resource from Resource Deposits. Wiki note: This bug is still not fixed entirely.
*Origins 3.0 - Blueprint changed, formerly used Advanced Ion Battery, which is now obsolete. Replaced with Ion Battery. Range no longer needs to be within base range.
additional_info:
*Once installed, a red light will flash on the top of the device while it is working. It will slowly grow in size as the resource is harvested. Once full, the light will turn green.
*When installing an AMU, be sure to place a Save Beacon nearby, or it will be hard to locate later.
*A fully charged device will harvest a maximum of 250 units over a time period of roughly 60 minutes.
*The device can not be picked up but it can be deleted for a full refund like any other base item when in construction range of a base.
*Workarounds for the bug that causes the AMU to collect the wrong resource:
**Delete and rebuild it. This is free and always possible, otherwise only if it is built within the boundary of a base you own, but not possible otherwise. Note: Any content and fuel left in the device when deleted is lost if not collected before.
**When collecting the resource from the AMU leave behind 10 of whatever the item is and it should not change what it collects.
*Only 5 AMUs can be placed in any local area.

title: Barnacle
summary: Barnacle is an item used in base building.
game_description:
A tenacious arthropod, naturally found encrusting stationary or slow-moving underwater objects.

This variety can be encouraged to affix itself to a chosen position, adding an aged marine apeearance to bases.
release_history: * Abyss - added as a base-building component
additional_info: The blueprint can be purchased from the Quicksilver Synthesis Companion in the Space Anomaly for 500

title: Barrel Fabricator
summary:
Barrel Fabricator  is a Cargo Drop.

Once placed, they take one hour in real time to fabricate a random canister item. Once the item is fabricated, the canister's glow lines turn from red to green, and any player with an AtlasPass v1 will be able to claim the item and restart the fabrication process. Moving a moderate distance away may also reset the container as ready to claim, many times without locking the container again.

The product fabricated is dependent on location. If you delete a fabricator and build another in the same place, it will produce the same resource. Resources produced in rough order of frequency are:

* Antimatter
* Antimatter Housing
* 33~35 Condensed Carbon
* Navigation Data
* Warp Cell
game_description: Regularly fabricates useful items for its constructor. Item retrieval requires an AtlasPass v1 for identity verification.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from the Construction Research Station.
release_history: * Pathfinder - Added as a base building product.
additional_info: *See Crate Fabricator for similar item fabrication container

title: Barricade
summary:
Barricade' is an item used in base building. 

The blueprint is acquired from the Construction Research Station.
game_description: Buildable ornament to beautify your base.
release_history: * Frontiers - added as a base-building component

title: Base Computer
summary:
Base Computer is a Base Building is only enabled once a Base computer is deployed and successfully activated.

When deployed, the Base Computer can be interacted with to establish a new base.  The base first must be activated, which checks to ensure no other base computer in the area has claimed part of the nearby territory.  If activation is successful, it will create a buildable area around itself. This will enable the construction of all base components found in the Build Menu.

Once a base is established, the Base Computer can also be interacted with to rename the base, change the base's thumbnail screenshot or delete the base altogether, which removes both the Base Computer and everything constructed around it.
game_description:
thumb|A base computer prior to base construction
Portable land registration service.

When placed, contacts Universal Cartographic Archive to establish ownership of land. Successful registration allows the construction of base modules across any site of the user's choosing.
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a base building product.
* Synthesis - Cost reduced for building, was 40 Chromatic Metal
* Frontiers - Base Computer can be picked up and moved.
additional_info:
* Picking up a base computer before it has been used to claim a location will return the base computer to the player's inventory as a constructed portable device item. 
* Deleting a claimed base will destroy the computer and it is not returned to the player's inventory.
* Claiming a base area only claims it in one incarnation of the universe, for example in the Normal universe, the creative universe, etc in whatever game mode you are claiming in the game save.  The same location on other modes will not be claimed prior to the Permadeath and Expeditions game mode bases. 
* The name associated with the base computer can be changed and if it is done before using a teleporter associated with it, that name will be on the selection list of other teleporters.
* Once the player has reached a certain point in the Alone Amidst the Stars mission, the base computer will begin to uncover useful blueprints from its archives every 90 minutes as part of the Base Computer Archives mission.
*It is possible to find procedurally generated unclaimed base computers out in the wild, meaning the player is able to go through a portal, claim the base, go back through the portal, go to the Space Anomaly's teleporter and teleport to the claimed base.<ref>[https://www.reddit.com/r/NMSCoordinateExchange/comments/gkw9j4/get_yourself_to_euclid_core_in_no_time_unclaimed/ Unclaimed wild base computer in Euclid]</ref>
* If you delete a base, it will not be possible to reclaim the area immediately, as it will still be claimed. This effect wears off after approximately three days; as the claim on the area is then removed from the servers; following the deletion of the base. After that, anyone, including you, can claim the site again.
* The base computer can now be picked up and moved within the bounds of the base (added feature, as of Update 3.73). The centre of the base does not change. Moving the base computer is only moving the item; not moving the potential area of the base.
*If you place a second base computer in the area of another base computer, you will be able to place it down, but unable to claim a the area. The stated error is that the Universal Cartography Records indicate a claim has already been made to this area.

title: Base Salvage Capsule
summary: Base Salvage Capsule is a base building product and it contains refunded materials from previous planetary bases (if you have any).
game_description:
A construction recovery device.

This optional piece of base technology stores and preserves matter left over after the destruction of a previous base.
release_history: * NEXT - Added as a base building product.
additional_info:
* When a base is deleted via the Base Computer, half of the materials used in its construction will be retrievable from the Base Salvage Capsule.
*The blueprint for constructing a Base Salvage Capsule is automatically unlocked after a player gets their first freighter.
*In the save editor, there is a raw JSON file which depicts the "MagicChest" inventory. This packet stores half the items from your deleted bases via the Base Salvage Capsule, but it should be built on a planetary base. On a freighter, it will not function due to a seperate "MagicChest2" inventory that this capsule would have been tied to but never used, even if the freighter base is reset. (Confirmed Bug)
* It is not needed prior to deleting an old base in order for the materials to be refunded, it simply allows the player to retrieve the refunded materials.
* When already built, a Base Salvage Capsule appears as a Previous Base Cache. 
* Base Salvage Capsule can interfere with the proximity limit number of refiners. (Admin note: Reported, requires verification)

title: Base Teleport Module
summary:
Base Teleport Module is a base building product, which allows the player to quickly teleport between any bases and space stations they have visited previously.

A
game_description:
A personal teleport device, allowing the user to move quickly between their constructed bases, as well as any Space Station Terminuses connected to their network.

User is urged to verify network integrity before inserting any matter they cannot afford to become separated from.
release_history:
* Pathfinder - Added as a method of transportation.
* NEXT - Added as a base building product.
* Beyond - Formula changed, previously used Ionised Cobalt and Ion Battery.
* Origins - Portal interference removed, visual interaction and assortment of destinations (bases, space stations, other player bases) now consistent with visual interface from Anomaly.
* Endurance - No longer can be built on Freighters, replaced by Teleport Chamber.
additional_info:
thumb|Teleporter ready for action
* Although referred to as the "Base Teleport Module" when constructed, the in-game interface names this structure the Teleportation Terminal when interacted with.
* You must complete an early portion of the tutorial to build and use a teleporter.
* There is no cost to teleporting (other than the time it takes to load the destination map).
* Only one teleporter per base is permitted, however this can be worked around by building additional

infobox.desc: Instant method of moving great distances

title: Battery
summary: Battery is a base building product that stores excess generated power. It can supply power to a base's electrical grid when the generators are offline.
game_description:
Highly-efficient energy storage units. Connect to a power grid, and onboard power management circuits will automatically draw down spare capacity to charge its cells.

When the grid attempts to draw more power than is currently supplied, the battery will automatically deploy power to make up the shortfall.
source_info: The blueprint can be obtained from the Construction Research Station aboard the Space Anomaly, costing 3 Salvaged Data to unlock.
release_history: * Beyond 2.09.1 - Fixed an issue that caused Batteries and Solar Panels to not attach correctly to building roofs.

The item is for decoration only and serves no function in the actual game.
game_description: A generously proportioned single bed, designed to accommodate most bipedal races, with minimum overhang of extremities.

title: Bewitching Cactus
summary: Bewitching Cactus is an item used in base building.

Elegant feathery filaments run around this desert plant, increasing the surface area for moisture absorption. They also look very fetching.

Provides decorative landscaping opportunities for bases.
additional_info: The blueprint can be purchased from the Quicksilver Synthesis Companion in the Space Anomaly for 500

title: Bio-Dome
summary:
Bio-Dome is a plant up to 16 items indoors. This structure cannot be built inside Freighter bases.

The blueprint can only be obtained via Base Research Terminal inside the Anomaly.
game_description: An attractive domed room which is perfect for cultivating a wide range of botanical matter.
release_history:
* Foundation - added as a base-building component
* Atlas Rises - formula changed, formerly used Titanium, Glass, and Suspension Fluid
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Titanium, Glass, and Living Glass. The blueprint cannot be obtained from the blueprint merchant any longer.
* Beyond - Now require power to operate
additional_info:
* A corridor attached to a bio-dome will allow the full 16 slots to grow plants, even though one of them will be placed under the stairs attaching the corridor to the bio-dome. 

* Bio-Domes should mainly be used for plants that are not compatible with growing outdoors. This will save slots inside your domes for plants that are not outdoors hardy.
* Fully grown plants can be harvested all at once by interacting with the display panels that are mounted on the ceiling of the Bio-Dome.
* A Bio-Dome consumes 50kPs of power to operate. As Large Hydroponic Trays require 20kPs to provide four growing slots, therefore Bio-Domes are more efficient for growing.

title: Biofuel Reactor

Connect power generators to base structures and technologies with electrical wiring. Many parts require power to function.
source_info: The blueprint can be obtained from the Construction Research Unit.
release_history:
* Beyond - Added as a base building product.
* Living Ship - Blueprint changed to reduce Oxygen requirement, formerly 40.
* Endurance - Operation time on full power increased from one to 50 hours; charging resource requirements drastically reduced.
additional_info: * Full charge requires 100 Carbon, 34 Condensed Carbon, or 50 Oxygen

title: Construction Research Unit
summary:
Construction Research Unit is a portable Hazard Protection Unit
*Timber Shelters (Formerly Wooden Shelters)
**Includes floor panels, wall panels, roof panels, doorways and variants thereof.
*Stone Shelters (Formerly Concrete Shelters)
**Includes floor panels, wall panels, roof panels, doorways and variants thereof.
*Alloy Shelters (Formerly Metal Shelters)
**Includes floor panels, wall panels, roof panels, doorways and variants thereof.

Similar to the Construction Research Station, parts further down the tree can only be researched after all parts preceding them have been researched.
game_description:
Portable blueprint decryption device.

This field-deployable memory salvage module allows the user to convert Salvaged Data technology modules into advanced construction blueprints.
source_info: The blueprint for the Construction Research Unit can be acquired from the base building tutorial which you will access from the Base Computer after starting your first base.<ref>See [https://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2019-08-16-no-mans-sky-bases-computer-construction-research-unit-base-teleport-module-6042 Eurogamer:No Man's Sky Bases: How to build a Base Computer, Construction Research Unit and Base Teleport Module]</ref>
release_history: *Beyond - Added as a constructed technology as a replacement for the Blueprint Analyser.

game_description:

This module is placed as an entire room and comes with its functional units pre-installed.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a technology

title: Crate Fabricator
summary:
Crate Fabricator is a Damaged Container.

Once placed, they take one hour in real time to fabricate a random container item. Once the item is fabricated, the container's glow lines turn from red to green, and any player will be able to claim the item and restart the fabrication process.

Moving a moderate distance away, or traveling to another location will reset the container as ready to claim again.
game_description: Buildable ornament to beautify your base.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from the Blueprint Analyser.
release_history: * Pathfinder - Added as a base building product.
additional_info:
* All freighters have one Crate Fabricator by default in the open section of the build area.
*See Barrel Fabricator for similar fabricating container.

title: Door
summary:
A Door a Cylindrical or Square Room, a blank or doorway-equipped wooden, metal or concrete wall, or at the end of any corridor.

Doors require power to close; the default/unpowered state is open.
game_description: A compression-sealed, standard door suitable for all rooms and corridors.
release_history:
* Pathfinder - added as a base-building component.
* NEXT - Recipe changed from 20 Iron to 50 Pure Ferrite.
* Beyond - Doors now require power to close.
* ExoMech - Recipe changed, was 50 Pure Ferrite.
additional_info:
* Power consumption is 1kP
* The door blueprint is obtained from the space anomaly in exchange for 1 Salvaged Data
* When powered, a door cannot be manually opened. Power must be removed for the door to open. This can be accomplished by connecting the door to a Power Inverter controlled by a switch. A Proximity Switch near the door will work from either side.

title: Echinocactus
summary: Echinocactus is a drought-resistant succulent, whose seeds can be acquired from a hired Farmer, or purchased from the Construction Research Station in the Space Anomaly for 3 Salvaged Data.
game_description:
Native to barren biomes and capable of withstanding long periods of drought, Echinocactus is an edible succulent that responds well to cultivation, yielding a large but occasional harvest.

Suitable for hydroponic indoor planting. Ensure Barren climate before planting outdoors.

Approximate growing time: 16 hours
release_history:
* Foundation - Added as a product.
* NEXT 1.55 - Growing time changed, formerly it was 120 minutes.
* NEXT 1.58 - Blueprint changed, formerly used Chromatic Metal and Pyrite.
* Beyond - Growing time fixed in the game description. Harvested quantity increased from 100 to 156.
* ExoMech - Harvested quantity decreased, was 156.
additional_info:
* Farming the plant will produce 100 Cactus Flesh in roughly 16 hours of real-world time.
* The original name for Echinocactus, Cucrassula, likely comes from the real-world [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crassula Crassula] genus of succulent plants.

title: Electric Cube
summary:
Electric Cube is a exotic planets.

Picking it up gives 1 piece of the product, but it does not unlock its blueprint.

It can be found in the Build Menu under the Decoration/Glitches.
game_description: A rare stabilised glitch, retrieved from a malfunctioning planet. Safe for rehousing in habitable bases.
release_history: * Visions - Added as a product.
additional_info:
Electric Cube has a blueprint (Pure Ferrite x10), but it is not possible to unlock it through normal gameplay.

However, if the player has one specimen in their inventory, they can build as many in a row as their supply of Pure Ferrite allows.

title: Electrical Wiring
summary:
Electrical Wire is a base building product that connects various base building products to supply power to them.

Unlike most items in No Man's Sky, it costs nothing to build.
game_description:
High-capacity electrical wiring. Use wiring to connect Power generators to your base. Most technology as well as structures with embedded lighting systems, require a power source to operate.

Wiring can be connected to various switches to facilitate selective power flow.
source_info: This product can be found on the Build menu >> Power & Industry >> Industrial.
release_history: * Beyond - Added as a base building product.
additional_info:
*Wiring does not function when the power devices on each end are part of different bases - even if owned by the same player. No error is displayed in-game and instead just does not function.
*The visual lines indicating the wires can be hidden using a Electrical Cloaking Unit.
*Each individual segment counts as a separate item towards any building limits.

title: Electromagnetic Generator
summary: Electromagnetic Generator is a base building product that generates power from Electromagnetic Power Hotspots and does not need additional fuel to operate. It can be connected to various base building products with Electrical Wiring to supply power to them.
game_description:
When suitably placed in an area of high field strength, efficient electromagnetic dynamos are used to generate near limitless power.

Locate appropriate sites with the Surveying upgrade for the Analysis Visor. Power output will vary from site to site.
source_info: The blueprint can be obtained from the Construction Research Station aboard the Space Anomaly, costing 10 Salvaged Data to unlock.
release_history: * Beyond - Added as a base building product.
additional_info:
Electromagnetic Generators do NOT work across bases.  A hotspot must be within, or close to the boundaries of your base build limit to function properly.  Generators which are part of a different base will show they are directing power, however, the one inside your other base will be un-powered.

You can build multiple generators around the same spot and they will all generate about the same amount of power.  If one generates 150kps building and connecting four will give you 600kps.

title: Entwining Tree

A hardy evergreen tree, able to survive in a wide-range of climates.

Waxy leaves with a silvery underside provide excellent light harvesting abilities, as well as year-round interest and colour.

summary:

title: Exocraft Specialist's Room
summary: '''Exocraft Specialist's Room''' is a Freighter Base Building module accomodating Technician terminal.
game_description:
Integrated freighter research equipment tailored to the needs of exocraft mechanics, and equipped with bespoke vehicular design software.

This module is placed as an entire room and comes with its functional units pre-installed.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a technology

title: Exocraft Summoning Station
summary:
Exocraft Summoning Station is a base building product that is used to summon Exocraft. 

Once the station is built, the player can summon an exocraft on any planet in that system as long as the player has built the geobay for that exocraft somewhere else in the system.
game_description:
Construction allows the user to summon any owned Exocraft from anywhere else in that system.

Interfaces with the Exosuit Quick Command Menu to ease of use. Can be compressed and carried within the Exosuit with 20px|link=/35px|link=/35px|link= (PC/PS/XB) for later redeployment.
release_history:
* NEXT 1.63 - Added as a base building product.
* Living Ship - Fixed an issue where the station would not allow summoning of exocraft unless built 350u+ away from a base computer.
* ExoMech - Blueprint changed, previously required Magnetised Ferrite, Ion Battery, Antimatter.
* SentinelUp - Can now be picked up and carried around in the inventory.
additional_info: * The blueprint can be acquired from the Construction Research Station for 12 Salvaged Data.

title: Expanding Cube Gadget
summary:

The product can be purchased from the Quicksilver Synthesis Companion for 800
game_description:
An exclusive decorative curiosity.

This precisely crafted gadget utilises a localised gravitational field, delighting and fascinating base visitors.
release_history: *NEXT Update 1.64 - added as a collectible

A Bulkhead Door must be installed to allow access to exterior spaces.

title: Fleet Command Room
summary: Fleet Command Room is a base building product specifically designed for freighters, and used as a control center for a frigate fleet.
game_description:
Core Fleet Management Station. This advanced holographic communications station is vital for managing fleet expeditions from the comfort of your capital ship.

User is advised that a dedicated station is required to manage each fleet that will be sent on an expedition at a time, for example to have five simultaneous fleet expeditions, five of these terminal rooms will be required.
release_history:
* NEXT 1.51 - Fixed an issue where players were unable to build it in Creative mode.
* Endurance - New look and icon
* Waypoint - New look
additional_info: Fleet Command Stations in use display their assigned fleets. For active fleets, the ships are rotating (cyan color), while those awaiting debrief are stationary (green color).

title: Floor Switch
summary: Floor Switch is a base building product that is used to toggle power to buildings using Electrical Wiring.
game_description:
A power management device, the switch will toggle the flow of power when stood upon or otherwise activated.

Switches require both power and signal wires to control a device.
additional_info:
* The blueprint can be acquired from the Construction Research Station on the Space Anomaly for 1 Salvaged Data.
* The product will activate when a player is standing on it (measuring a 6x6u square) and deactivate again once no player is standing on it. This makes it useful for powering base products that only need to be powered when a player is nearby, such as Galactic Trade Terminal or Storage Container.
** Note: Leaving by the Base Teleport Module does not appear to trigger the Floor Switch to turn off.

title: Fossil Display
summary:
Fossil Display is a Base building decorative structure used to reassemble and showcase Ancient Bones excavated from Fossil Beds. Fossil Displays allow Travellers to arrange bones into complete animal forms for display within their bases.

A Fossil Display can be deployed on any planetary surface or inside a Freighter Base.
game_description:
A display stand designed to showcase the recovered remains of ancient lifeforms. Once placed, ancient bones can be arranged to re-create countless animal forms. A complete fossil requires a skull, a ribcage, two sets of limbs, and a tail.

Create a museum of assembled fossils at your base, or package your exhibits for trade on the open market, or with other Travellers. Find alien Fossil Collectors to trade with aboard Space Stations or at planetary Palaeontological Digs.
release_history: * Relics — This item was added as part of the Relics update, alongside the Collecting Fossils mission.
additional_info: * The blueprint is learned from a Construction Research Station aboard the Space Anomaly after starting the Collecting Fossils mission.

* Beyond - materials required reduced from 150 to 100

Construction unit is fabricated complete with pressure bulkhead and all necessary attachment points.

title: Freighter Storage Unit
summary:
Freighter Storage Units allow a player to store resources and products above and beyond what is available in a starship or exosuit inventory.

A maximum of ten storage units (labelled 0 through 9) may be built on a Freighter, with each container holding 20 stacks. Each stack will hold 9999 units of a specific resource (1000 in Survival mode), or four times as many of any other items (with the exception of Upgrade Modules) as each slot of the exosuit's inventory can hold.
game_description:
Hybrid high-capacity storage unit / shelving module for installation in interstellar freighters.

Compatible with all standard life-support fittings.
release_history:
* NEXT 1.60 - Added as a replacement to Storage Containers on freighters.
* Endurance - Deprecated and replaced by Storage Room.
additional_info:
* The player must be near the terminal within a storage unit in order to manually access its contents.
* Storage units are numbered from 0-9 in the Build Menu to correspond with Storage Containers with the same numbers.
* Each number can only be used once within a given freighter. A given storage unit shares its contents with all Storage Container instances with the same number (1 - 1, 2 - 2, and so on).
* Items can be moved from the exosuit, or starship, inventory to storage units while the player is within a freighter build area containing those storage units, or from anywhere with the Matter Beam upgrade installed.
** Items remotely transferred into storage units cannot be directed to a specific unit. Rather, it gets stacked into the first container (in order from 0 to 9) with an open slot. If the container the item would get deposited into already has a stack of that item, it gets stacked.

* Items may be retrieved from a storage unit by
**opening the freighter's inventory menu while the freighter is in the current system, and navigating through each container as if they were additional inventory tabs;
**requesting items to an empty exosuit or starship slot while in the freighter build area, or anywhere else with the Matter Beam upgrade installed in the freighter;
**physically interacting with the unit's terminal and transferring items directly.
*There seems to be a glitch where sometimes you cannot take things out of a certain container, instead showing the description of a technology in the Starship.
** The issue can be circumvented by taking out a different item stack first, allowing the original item stack to be taken but duplicating an item stack in exosuit inventory.

title: Frostwort
summary:
300px|thumb|right|Frostwort in its natural habitat.
Frostwort is a wild plant found naturally only on icy planets and seeds can be acquired from a hired Farmer, or purchased from the Construction Research Station in the Space Anomaly for three Salvaged Data. Harvesting requires Haz-Mat Gauntlets.
game_description:
A large crystal flower with radiant blue blooms, found only in snowy biomes. Frostwort can be farmed and makes a reliable crop, and its adaptation to harsh conditions results in highly frequent harvests.

Suitable for hydroponic indoor planting. Ensure Frozen climate before planting outdoors.

Approximate growing time: 1 hour
release_history:
* Foundation - Added as a product.
* NEXT 1.55 - Growing time changed, formerly it was 15 minutes.
* NEXT 1.58 - Blueprint changed, formerly used ExoMech - Harvested quantity decreased from 78 to 50.
additional_info:
* Growing the plant will produce 50-100 Frost Crystal in roughly 1 hour of real time.
*With Optical Drill installed on the Multi-tool and planted in a Bio-Dome, each plant will produce 81 Frost Crystals.

title: Hydroponic Tray
summary:
thumb|Hydroponics lab using numerous trays
This item provides a growing platform for indoor farming in a base or on a freighter. It is a required item for those plants that can only be grown indoors.

There is a quad version of this technology called the Large Hydroponic Tray that can be placed in the centre of large Cuboid Rooms.
game_description: A self-contained growth system for the indoor cultivation of agricultural crops. Build requirement: must be placed indoors.
source_info: thumb|right|Hydroponics tray
release_history:
* NEXT 1.64 - Fixed an issue where players could fail to be given the blueprints for Hydroponic Trays.
* Beyond 2.09.1 - Fixed a number of issues that prevented hydroponic trays from working with base power.
additional_info:
* When building a tray, red arrows will be displayed on the floor of the room indicating acceptable locations for the tray. These can be touchy, and there are certain locations where a tray cannot be placed, even though there is no apparent reason why not. This is most likely a bug.
* In certain circumstances, a tray will disappear from its location, leaving the plants it contains suspended in mid-air. This is also a software bug.
* You can build Hydroponic Tray (or the large version) outdoors as long as there is a floor under it.
* Hydroponic Tray is powered by the general base power, or freighter if it is placed there.
* Power consumption is 5kP, uses room for power source, also has outlet for cable
* Blueprint Research cost is 3x Salvaged Data modules.

title: L-Shaped Corridor
summary:

Advanced nano-mineral coating ensures high performance at depth, without compromising visibility.

title: Ladder
summary:
Ladder is a Base building structure used to allow vertical traversal within bases.

The ladder's preview auto-snaps to central vertical anchors, but placement requires support at both bottom and top (a vertical shaft that extends beyond the ladder's final height counts as support for placement purposes).
game_description: A strong, lightweight ladder with reinforced anchor points for attaching to walls.
release_history:
* NEXT - This item was added as a base-building component.
* Synthesis - "Ladder" appears in some spots instead of "Climb Ladder'
additional_info:
*The blueprint for Ladder is learned from a Blueprint Analyser.
* This item is referred to as Climb Ladder in some places in the game, which is most likely a bug (report it here on [https://hellogames.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/requests/new Zendesk]).

title: Ladder Module
summary: Ladder Module is a base building product specifically designed for freighters.

An inbuilt freighter ladder for traversing vertically between freighter decks.

Attaches directly to corridors.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a product.

title: Landing Pad
summary:
Landing Pad is a base building product that provides a platform where starships can land and take off. This includes not only the player's ship, but NPC traders. 

*Players may call their ship to a landing pad using Navigation Data.
*Taking off from a landing pad has no Launch Thruster cost.
*Starships will be placed upon available landing pads when teleporting back to the player’s base.
*When constructing a Landing Pad, they can only be attached to the following items:
** any flatpack full-sized wall panel (wooden, concrete, or steel)
** Glass Roofed Corridor
** Straight Corridor
** Cylindrical Room
** Cuboid Room
** Door
game_description:
thumb|Landing Pad attached to a base
A stable, reinforced landing pad for starships.
release_history:
* Foundation - Added as a base building product.
* NEXT 1.63 - Teleporting back to the player's base places the starship on the landing pad, previously it did not. Fixed an issue that could allow multiple starships to be docked on the same landing pad in multiplayer.
* Beyond - Due to the increase of the size of starships, the landing pad was removed from all existing bases and can be re-acquired by rebuilding them.
additional_info:
* The blueprint is acquired from the Base Computer Archives mission.
* If any sort of structure is placed directly above the Landing Pad, it will prevent NPC ships landing on it.
* When selecting a pad to place it, you may notice a small screen standing upward at the corner. You can rotate the landing pad, and when you do, it will change the direction any ship faces whenever it lands there. The small screen will face away from the left side of the ship - for example, if it is desired that the ship point north after landing, make sure the small screen faces west.

title: Large Glass Panel
summary:
Large Glass Panel is a base building product which replaces a large structure panel with a window.

The window object is only useful for changing the appearance of Cylindrical Rooms and Square Rooms; Deepwater Chambers and Square Deepwater Chambers, though they are also valid targets, come equipped with Large Glass Panels by default, making placement redundant.
game_description: A window made from self-cleaning, UV-treated, hermetically sealed glass.
source_info: The blueprint is awarded as part of Dreams of the Deep; however, it can also be unlocked early using a Blueprint Analyser.
release_history: * Abyss - Added as a base building product.

title: Large Hydroponic Tray
summary: This item provides a growing platform for indoor farming in a base, on a freighter, or in the proper outdoor environments. It is a required item for those plants that can only be grown indoors and can handle four plants at once (as compared to the single Hydroponic Tray. This type of tray can be placed on a floor panel or Cuboid Room.
game_description:
thumb|Large hydroponic trays in a freighter
A self-contained growth system for the cultivation of agricultural crops (usually done indoors). Can support up to four plants.
release_history:
* NEXT 1.64 - Fixed an issue where players could fail to be given the blueprints for Hydroponic Trays.
* Prisms? - Blueprint changed, previously required Ionised Cobalt.
* Endurance - Can no longer be placed on Freighters.
additional_info:
* When building a tray, red arrows will be displayed on the floor of the Cuboid Room indicating acceptable locations for the tray. These can be touchy, and there are certain locations where a tray cannot be placed, even though there is no apparent reason why not. 
* Power consumption is 20kP, and will use room for power source. An outlet for a power source exists if needed outdoors.

title: Large Refiner
summary:
A Large Refiner is a base building product for purifying and combining three elements to create another or to crack higher unique elements to create smaller and more concentrated resources. It is the largest of the four Refiners.

For example, it can be used to refine Gold, Silver, and Cadmium into  Chromatic Metal x10. 

Some end products of the refinery tree are reversible.
game_description:
A vital piece of planetary equipment. The Refiner allows gathered substances to be processed into more powerful and more advanced materials.

The Large Refiner allows three different substances to be combined into one new material, or materials to be processed at better ratios. 

The Large Refiner must be installed in a Habitable Base, but does not require additional power sources.
release_history: *NEXT - Added as a base building product.

title: Light Fissure
summary:
Light Fissure is a exotic planets.

Picking it up gives 1 piece of the product, but it does not unlock its blueprint.

It can be found in the Build Menu under the Decoration/Glitches.
game_description: A rare stabilised glitch, retrieved from a malfunctioning planet. Safe for rehousing in habitable bases.
release_history: * Visions - Added as a product.
additional_info:
Light Fissure has a blueprint (Pure Ferrite x10), but it is not possible to unlock it through normal gameplay.

However, if the player has one specimen in their inventory, they can build as many in a row as their supply of Pure Ferrite allows.

title: Livestock Unit
summary:
Livestock Unit is a base building product. It requires power to operate.

It will automatically collect any available Animal Byproducts from nearby creatures that have recently eaten a creature pellet.

Player has to baby-sit the process as the animals wanders off when unattended.
game_description:
A robotic milk, eggs or other specialist produce will approach the Livestock Unit and deposit their yields. The creatures are unharmed by the process.

Will harvest produce from creatures fed by hand or via an Automated Feeder.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from the Construction Research Station on the Space Anomaly for 10 Salvaged Data.
release_history: * Beyond - Added as a base building product.
additional_info:
* Power consumption is 20kP
*The Livestock Unit has a total of fifteen (15) regular storage slots, but they can only be used for substances recently harvested. However, as the game tends to forget the substances that the Livestock Unit stores, it is recommended to extract food items from it as soon as possible before they rot.
*Limited to ten (10) Livestock Units per base.

title: Locked Crate
summary:
Locked Crate is a base building product which is only useful for aesthetics. Despite being in the Storage category in the Build Menu, it is incapable of holding items.

The object can be placed on any free horizontal surface.
game_description: Regularly fabricates useful items for its constructor.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from the Blueprint Analyser.
release_history:
* Pathfinder - Added as a base building product.
* ExoMech - type and game description changed, formerly was a Decoration
additional_info: * While the game description claims to fabricate items, it currently does not.

title: Marine Rock
summary: Marine Rock is an item used in base building.
game_description:
A pleasing mineral formation, crystallised from oceaanic salts. May contain aquatic fossils and/or lifeforms.

Provides decorative landscaping opportunities for bases.
additional_info: The blueprint can be purchased from the Quicksilver Synthesis Companion in the Space Anomaly for 500

title: Marine Shelter
summary:
Marine Shelter is a portable base building product within which the player can take refuge to escape the dangers of the waters. This structure can only be placed underwater. 

The blueprint is primarily acquired from the Dreams of the Deep mission, but it also can be obtained from the Blueprint Analyser prior to the mission.
game_description:
An emergency survival module.

Can be rapidly deployed on the seabed in the event of an oxygen or other Exosuit life support emergency. Provides temporary shelter from environmental hazards, predators and other hostiles forces found in the deep ocean.
additional_info: *Marine Shelter, when dismantled, is returned to inventory as a single item rather than as its construction materials.

title: Medium Refiner
summary:
A Medium Refiner is a base building product for purifying and combining two elements to create another or to crack higher unique elements to create smaller and more concentrated resources. It is the middle-sized option of the four Refiners.

For example, a refiner can be used to refine Pyrite and Oxygen into Cactus Flesh, but reduces materials like Carbon Crystal to 150 Condensed Carbon as well.

Some end products of the refinery tree are reversable. (see below for other operations)
game_description:
A vital piece of planetary equipment. The Refiner allows gathered substances to be processed into more powerful and more advanced materials.

The Medium Refiner allows two different substances to be combined into one new material, or materials to be processed at better ratios.

The Medium Refiner must be installed in a Habitable Base, but does not require additional power sources.
release_history:
*NEXT - Added as a base building product.
*Beyond - Blueprint can be purchased on the anomaly.
*Waypoint - removed from Base Computer Archives mission.
additional_info: The Medium Refiner blueprint costs 10 Salvaged Data to unlock at the Space Anomaly.

title: Message Module
summary:
Message Module is a base building product and can be found in the Equipment/Portable Technology building category. 

It allows players to leave behind messages for other players to find similarly to the Communications Station. After building the Message Module the player will need to interact with it to set its message.

The message does not require activation to be read, instead it is displayed as white glowing text in the center of screen for anyone who approaches the Message Module.
game_description: A small and accessible information container for leaving messages or viewing left messages and short strings of information.
source_info: As of Beyond, the blueprint is available from the construction technology vendor at the Anomaly.

summary:
alt=|thumb|Vertical Indium farm with extractors
Mineral Extractor is a base building product that can be used to automatically harvest minerals.
game_description:
An automated mineral harvester. Determine a Deep-Level Mineral Deposit site with the Surveying upgrade for the Analysis Visor. Mineral extraction rates and produced minerals will vary from site to site.

Requires power to function. Connect to Supply Depots with Supply Pipes to allow collection from more convenient sites.
source_info: The blueprint can be obtained from the Construction Research Station aboard the Space Anomaly, costing 10 Salvaged Data to unlock.
release_history:
*Beyond - Added as a base building product.
*Origins - mineral extractors returns grow less the more are placed in one location (diminishing returns).
additional_info:
thumb|Mineral Extractor in use

*Available minerals for extraction vary from planet to planet and biome to biome.
*Every extractor can store 250 units of minerals.
*Every mineral extractor cycle produces 250 units of minerals for the extraction network.
*The building continues to produce minerals while the game is not running. Supply depots can hold this automatic harvest.

title: Mini Weathered Hanging

title: Monitor Station
summary:
Monitor Station is a base building product.

The blueprint is acquired from the Construction Research Unit or Construction Research Station.

The item is for decoration only and serves no function in the actual game.
game_description: Buildable ornament to beautify your base.

title: Moon Pool Floor
summary:
Moon Pool Floor is a base building product which creates a "hole" in the bottom of a room, allowing the player to swim up into it from below. 

The object's preview only auto-snaps to the bottom surfaces of the following underwater structures: Cylindrical Room, Square Room, Deepwater Chamber, and Square Deepwater Chamber.
game_description:
A holographic moon pool hatch. Allows easy access into and out of aquatic environments.

Pressurisation systems are automatically and discreetly hidden around the room.
source_info: The blueprint is awarded as part of Dreams of the Deep; however, it can also be unlocked early using a Blueprint Analyser.
release_history:
* Abyss - Added as a base building product.
* Living Ship - changed formula amounts, was 350/6/2
additional_info: (PS4) Due to a recent bug, it creates an air pocket, however a Nautilon can still drive underneath.

title: Mordite Root
summary: Mordite Root seeds can be acquired from a hired Farmer, or purchased from the Construction Research Station in the Space Anomaly for 3 Salvaged Data,
game_description:
An inedible tuber that produces a small yield of Mordite crystals.

A peaceful alternative to the process of harvesting Mordite from the corpses of creatures. Mordite Root must be grown in a Hydroponics Tray.

Approximate growing time: 8 hours
release_history:
* Foundation - Added as a product.
* NEXT 1.55 - Growing time changed, formerly it was 60 minutes.
* NEXT 1.58 - Blueprint changed, formerly used Beyond - Growing time fixed in the game description. Harvested quantity increased from 25 to 39.
* ExoMech - Harvested quantity decreased from 39 to 25.
additional_info:
* Growing the plant will produce 25 Mordite in roughly 8 hours of real time.
* When grown, this plant produces a tuber where the Mordite crystals mature.

title: NipNip
summary: NipNip seeds can be acquired from a hired Farmer.
game_description:
thumb|right|NipNip being farmed
This medicinal herb is known for its pungent buds, which are harvested to produce Gek Nip. NipNip thrives in dank environments, and often grows as a weed.

Suitable for hydroponic planting indoors. Needs a tropical or humid climate before planting outdoors.
release_history:
* Visions 1.76 - Fixed an issue where the Farmer would teach the wrong NipNip recipe. Blueprint changed, formerly used GekNip.

additional_info: * Growing the plant will produce 1  hybrid strains of NipNip.

title: Noise Box
summary: Noise Box is a base building product. It requires power to operate.

title: Nomad Geobay
summary:
Nomad Geobay is used to provide a safe parking lot for the Nomad Exocraft. Crafting the Geobay for the first time will automatically craft the Exocraft, which is immediately useable.  

Geobays can be placed anywhere, inside or outside of a claimed base. When a geobay is destroyed, the resources used to build it are returned.

All geobays have two terminals. One terminal, with a blue screen, is used to respawn the geobay's Exocraft; the other terminal, with an orange screen, grants access to Exocraft customisation of the vehicle's cosmetics, but not custsomization of the vehicle's performance upgrades.
game_description: An underground secure parking facility for the Nomad light Exocraft.
release_history: * NEXT 1.63 - Geobays can now be used to customise their respective Exocraft

title: Portable Refiner
summary:
A Portable Refiner is a portable base building product for purifying one element to create another or to crack higher unique elements to create smaller and more concentrated resources. It is the smallest of the four types of Refiners and can only work with recipes that use one resource only.

For example, a refiner can be used to refine Ferrite Dust into Pure Ferrite, but reduces materials like TetraCobalt to 150 Ionised Cobalt as well. 

Some end products of the refinery tree are reversible.
game_description:
A vital piece of planetary equipment. The Refiner allows gathered substances to be processed into more powerful and more advanced materials.

The Portable Refiner can be dismantled and redeployed for easy transportation. Note: the Portable Refiner requires fuel to operate.
release_history: *NEXT 1.51 - Fixed an issue where portable refiners placed near each other would share inventories.
additional_info: While in the Portable Refiner interface, environmental hazards do not affect you. If you're caught in a storm, placing and staring at a Portable Refiner until the storm ends will preserve your hazard protection.

title: Potted Plant
summary:
Potted Plant is a Base building product used for decoration.

game_description: A decorative pot for indoor plants.
release_history: * Pathfinder - This item was added as a base-building component.
additional_info: *The blueprint for Potted Plant can be learned from a Construction Research Unit or Construction Research Station in exchange for Salvaged Data modules.

title: Power Inverter
summary: Power Inverter is a base building product that is used to toggle power to buildings using Electrical Wiring.
game_description:
A power management device, the switch will toggle the flow of power when used.

Switches require both power and signal wires to control a device.
additional_info:
* The blueprint can be acquired from the Construction Research Station on the Space Anomaly for 1 Salvaged Data.
* The inverter functions based on three sockets: the input socket (marked with green lights) the output socket (marked with red lights) and the central control socket. The input socket should be connected to your main power grid, and the output socket should be connected to the device you want to to affect with the inverter. The inverter will send power through the output socket only when the control socket is not powered. It turns off when the control socket is powered.

summary: Proximity Switch is a base building product that is used to toggle power to buildings using Electrical Wiring.

A power management device, the switch will toggle the flow of power when an entity is detected nearby.

Switches require both power and signal wires to control a device.
release_history: * Beyond - Added as a base building product.
additional_info:
* The product will activate when a player comes within 7.5u of it and deactivate again once the activating player moves to further away than 9.5u from it. This makes it useful for powering base products that only need to be powered when a player is nearby, such as Appearance Modifier or Base Teleport Module.
** Note: Leaving by the Base Teleport Module does not appear to trigger the Proximity Switch to turn off.

title: Save Beacon
summary:
Save Beacon is a base building product that provides a permanent marker and allows the player to save upon interaction.

Its colour and material can be changed in the Build Menu. Changing the colour also changes the colour of its marker.

Maximum five beacons can be placed on a single planet. They are only visible to other players, if they are within the base building limit or if the other players have joined a multi-player session with the owner of the beacon.
game_description:
Once activated, beacons provide a permanent navigational waypoint, facilitating repeat visits to specific locations.

Allows user to record their progress at any time.
release_history:
* Foundation - Added as a product. Beacons now notify the player that they will save the game.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Voltaic Cell and Carite Sheet.
* Beyond - Renamed from Beacon to Save Beacon. Blueprint changed, formerly used Metal Plating, Ion Battery and Microprocessor.

title: Save Point
summary: Save Point is a Survival Mode, as they allow you to save your progress quickly and easily in harsh conditions.
game_description: A buildable save point for managing your progress.
release_history:
* Foundation - Added as product.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly required Platinum and Iron. It is now portable.
* Waypoint - No longer awarded during base archive missions.
* Interceptor - Can be researched from Construction Research Station.

title: Scanner Room
summary: Scanner Room is a Freighter Base Building module allowing remote scanning of all planets in the current Star system.
game_description:
Advanced integrated freighter equipment. Upon use, this planetary scanner probes all celestial bodies in the local solar system. This module is placed as an entire room and comes with its functional units pre-installed.

Scanned moons and planets are Discovered, and sensors collect high-level data such as weather conditions and prominent resources.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a technology

This module is placed as an entire room and comes with its functional units pre-installed.

title: Short-Range Teleporter
summary:
Short-Range Teleporter is a base building product that provide short distance rapid movement across a large base in any direction.  It is especially useful when a single base is divided into several different locations in the same area but are not easily accessible to each other on foot or via exocraft or starship.  

Short-range teleporters need to be deployed in pairs in a base to be functional.
game_description:
A low-powered teleporter, construction for instantaneous travel across short distances.

When wired to both a power source and another short-range teleporter, allows near-instant travel between nearby locations.
source_info: The blueprint can be obtained from the Construction Research Station aboard the Space Anomaly, costing 10 Salvaged Data to unlock.
release_history:
* Beyond - Added as a base building product.
* Desolation - No longer need to be powered (description still claims that 5kPs power is required).
* Endurance - Added to freighter base building.
additional_info:
* The Desolation update broke the power requirement where any entrance unit in the pair had to be powered (at 5kPs each) using Electrical Wiring, however if only one-directional travel was desired - the exit unit did not need to be powered. Due to this bug, no power is required at all for teleportation to work, although the 'no power' icon would show when hooked up. 
*

title: Sofa
summary:

game_description: Buildable ornament to beautify your base.
release_history: * Beyond - added as a base-building component

title: Solar Panel
summary: Solar Panel is a base building product that generates power from solar energy during the daytime. It can be connected to various base building products with Electrical Wiring to supply power to them.
game_description:
An efficient power generator, this solar array will turn sunlight into the electrical energy required to power many base structures.

Generates no power at night. Partner with Batteries to store energy for the hours of darkness.
source_info: The blueprint can be obtained from the Construction Research Station aboard the Space Anomaly, costing 8 Salvaged Data to unlock.
release_history:
* Beyond 2.09.1 - Fixed an issue that caused Batteries and Solar Panels not to attach correctly to building roofs.
* Living Ship - Blueprint changed, gold and chromatic metal quantities were both reduced

title: Solar Vine
summary: Solar Vine is a living rock that grows in extreme heat and seeds can be acquired from a hired Farmer, or purchased from the Construction Research Station in the Space Anomaly for 3 Salvaged Data,
game_description:
This 'living rock' is adapted to live in the extreme heat of scorched biomes. However, it can be farmed in most environments and, once established, yields a moderate harvest.

Suitable for hydroponic indoor planting. Ensure Hot climate before planting outdoors.

Approximate growing time: 16 hours
release_history:
* Foundation - Added as a product.
* NEXT 1.55 - Growing time changed, formerly it was 120 minutes.
* NEXT 1.58 - Blueprint changed, formerly used Beyond - Growing time fixed in the game description. Harvested quantity increased from 50 to 78.
* ExoMech - Harvested quantity decreased from 78 to 50.
additional_info: * Growing the plant will produce 50 Solanium in roughly 16 hours of real time.

title: Solid Cube
summary:
Solid Cube is a Base building object which is the solid equivalent of a Cuboid Room.

The small room component's preview auto-snaps to many horizontal and vertical anchors.
game_description: A large solid cube.
release_history: * Pathfinder - This item was added as a base-building component.
additional_info: *The blueprint for Solid Cube is learned from a Blueprint Analyser.

title: Spark Plug
summary:

game_description: Buildable ornament to beautify your base.
release_history: * Frontiers - added as a base-building component

title: Sphere
summary:
Sphere is a base building product.

The blueprint is acquired from the Construction Research Unit or Construction Research Station.

The item is for decoration only and serves no function in the actual game.
game_description: Basic structural buildable item.

title: Sphere Creator
summary: Sphere Creator is a base building product. It requires power to operate.
game_description:
A highly-specific fabrication device, developed with the intention of finding the universe's most perfect sphere.

Requires power to operate. Will create a large sphere, ready for whatever experiments are deemed necessary.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from the Construction Research Station on the Space Anomaly for 10 Salvaged Data.
release_history: * Beyond - Added as a base building product.
additional_info:
* Power consumption is null, but sending an electrical pulse to it will generate a sphere.
* There is a possible bug associated with the interplanetary "star-gate" portals. If you delete the sphere creator while its created sphere is inside the cylindrical warp zone, you will be instantly transported to the inputted planetary coordinates even though you are at a far distance away from the star-gate. Further research required.

title: Spindle Tree
summary: Spindle Tree is an item used in base building. It is a tall thin tree,
game_description: A thin, non-fruiting tree. Root system is integrated with highly-adapted fungal symbiotes.\n\nSupplied with its own mushrooms for ease of establishment. Fungus is non-toxic and non-spreading.
release_history: * NEXT - added as a base-building component

game_description: Buildable ornament to beautify your base.
release_history: * Frontiers - added as a base-building component

title: Square Deepwater Chamber
summary:
Square Deepwater Chamber is a base building product which is the underwater-exclusive equivalent of Square Room.

This structure's preview auto-snaps to many horizontal and vertical anchors.
game_description: A square alternative to the core module for base construction, providing a generous central space on which to expand.
source_info: The blueprint is given automatically when the player acquires the blueprint for Square Room.
release_history: * Abyss - Added as a base building product.

title: Square Room
summary:
thumb|Square room in use
A Square Room is a structure designed to act as a standalone room. 

Square rooms are rooms that can be added onto. Windows can be built on the walls. They can be stacked vertically, with ladders being used to connect the floors. Bio-Domes may be placed on top. It may also be connected with corridors, to create larger structures.
game_description: A square alternative to the core module for base construction, providing a generous central space on which to expand.
release_history:
* Pathfinder - added as a base-building component
* NEXT - recipe changed from 100 Iron to 350 Pure Ferrite
additional_info:
* The blueprint can be acquired via the Blueprint Analyser
* Blueprint Research cost is 3x Salvaged Data modules
* Power consumption is 10kP

title: Squared Standing Light
summary:
Squared Standing Light is an item used in base building. There are at least four different varieties:

* Squared Standing Light
* Rounded Standing Light
* Capped Standing Light
* Lantern
game_description: A low-energy consumption light, with an extended lifespan and fully recyclable components.
release_history:
* Pathfinder - added as a base-building component.
* NEXT - blueprint changed, formerly used Heridium and Voltaic Cell.
* Frontiers - renamed, formerly "Light".
additional_info: * Power consumption is 1kP

title: Standing Planter
summary:
Standing Planter is a base building product and can be found in the Equipment/Farming building category.

It provides 62-120 units of Carbon every 10 minutes.
game_description: A standing planter system for indoor cultivation of agricultural crops.
release_history:
* Farmable agricultural products no longer can be planted into it.
* NEXT - Hidden changes: Blueprint no longer can be acquired through normal gameplay. Blueprint changed, formerly used Carite Sheet and Power Gel.
* Living Ship - Fixed an issue that had caused Carbon Planters to be unavailable for purchase. Blueprint changed, in NEXT required Carbon.
* Origins - Blueprint revised from 20 Condensed Carbon to 25.
additional_info:
* This item does not need to be recharged, but requires a connection to a power source.
*MAYBE BUG, DEFINITELY EXPLOIT - When constructing on a Freighter, it is built ready to harvest with 75 Carbon. When you deconstruct it, you get back all resources. This allows you to get infinite Carbon by constructing, harvesting, deconstructing, and reconstructing.
*Alternatively, you can select the move tool from the base menu and when you reset the planter, it will have the Carbon on it again.
*MAYBE BUG, DEFINITELY EXPLOIT - When constructing in your base, the standing planter does not require any power to be harvested. In order to spawn the Carbon, you can use a terminus to warp away and back to your base. This will result in a full planter ready for harvest and can be done repeatedly for infinite Carbon. 
*

title: Star Bramble
summary: Star Bramble is a farmable agricultural Farmer, or purchased from the Construction Research Station in the Space Anomaly for 3 Salvaged Data,
game_description:
A medium-sized, farmable plant that yields an occasional harvest of valuable Star Bulbs.

Suitable for hydroponic indoor planting. Ensure Lush climate before planting outdoors.

Approximate growing time: 4 hours
release_history:
* Foundation - Added as a product.
* NEXT 1.55 - Growing time changed, formerly it was 30 minutes. 
* NEXT 1.58 - Blueprint changed, formerly used Chromatic Metal and Paraffinium.
* Beyond - Growing time fixed in the game description.
additional_info:
* Growing the plant will produce 25 Star Bulbs in roughly 4 hours of real time.
* It can be found on Lush planets along with its planting source, Paraffinium.
* With Optical Drill installed on the Multi-tool and planted in a Bio-Dome, each plant will produce 41 Star Bulb.

title: Stellar Extractor Room
summary: Stellar Extractor Room is a Freighter Base Building module allowing gathering of stellar resources.
game_description:
Advanced integrated freighter equipment. Gathers resources directly from the interstellar medium, via a complex system of suction intakes and condensing tubes. The gathered substance varies with the local star classification.

This module is placed as an entire room and comes with its functional units pre-installed.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a technology
additional_info:
The Stellar Extractor Room allows the automatic production of materials based on the classification of the current Purple Stars yield Methane
* Additionally, if any of these materials are within the freighter's cargo containers, any produced material will be automatically deposited into the present stacks upon jumping the Freighter to another Star System.
