title: Storage Container
summary:
Storage Containers allow a player to store resources and products above and beyond what is available in a starship or exosuit inventory.

A maximum of ten containers (labelled 0 through 9, although they can be renamed) may be built, with each container holding fifty stacks. Each stack will hold 9999 units of a specific resource, or 20 of certain special items that normally holds 10 per stack like Vortex Cubes.
game_description: Spacious additional storage for inventory items.
release_history:
* Foundation - Introduced to the game.
* Beyond 2.05 - Fixed an issue where storage containers could not be accessed.
* Synthesis 2.20 - Slots increased from 5 to 20. Containers can now be named.
* Waypoint - Slots increased from 20 to 50.
additional_info:
* Storage Container 0's blueprint is the first blueprint uncovered by the Overseer early on in the advanced base-building quest.
* Storage containers are numbered from 0-9 to make them easier to identify. Each container can be colored and renamed to provide additional visual clues as to their contents.
* Each number can only be used once per base. Instances of the same container share their contents with their associated number (1 - 1, 2 - 2, and so on).
* Items can be moved from the exosuit's or starship's inventory to storage containers at any time.
* Items may be retrieved from a storage container by either:
** Physically interacting with a container. You must be facing the front of container (the part that looks like a Galactic Trade Terminal) in order to access the contents.
** Pressing the "quick transfer" key bind when the cursor is hovering above an empty slot in the exosuit's inventory as long as the user is near any Base Computer.
* When moving items to a storage container there is no way to direct them to a specific container when not near them. If a stack (or more) already exist in one of the containers (provided there is enough space for the new item) the item(s) will be stacked automatically in their appropriate storage container, otherwise a new stack is created in one of the containers, if there is room.
* If the container loses power, the items inside are not lost, but cannot be retrieved by interacting with the container until the power is restored. However, they can still be retrieved from an unpowered container using an empty slot in the exosuit.
* If all containers with a specific number are deleted (e.g. all 0 containers are deleted) - the items inside are also not lost, but cannot be retrieved even via an empty slot in the exosuit until at least one instance of the container is rebuilt in any base.
*All containers of a specific number are linked and share inventories, including the freighter version.

title: Storage Container - Yellow
summary:
Storage Container is a Damaged Container.

Once placed, they take 1 hour in real time to fabricate a random container item. Once the item is fabricated, the container's glow lines turn from red to green, and any player will be able to claim the item and restart the fabrication process.
game_description: Buildable ornament to beautify your base.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from the Blueprint Analyser.

title: Storage Panel
summary:
Storage Panel is a base building product.

The blueprint is acquired from the Construction Research Unit or Construction Research Station.

The item is for decoration only and serves no function in the actual game.
game_description: Builable ornament to beautify your base.

title: Storage Room
summary:
Storage Rooms allow a player to store resources and products above and beyond what is available in a starship or exosuit inventory.

A maximum of ten storage units (labelled 0 thru 9) may be built on a freighter, with each container holding 50 stacks. Each stack will hold 9999 units of a specific resource (1000 in Survival mode), or twice as many of any other items (including unopened Upgrade Modules) as each slot of the exosuit's inventory can hold.
game_description:
Hybrid high-capacity storage unit shelving module for installation in interstellar freighters. This module is placed as an entire room and comes with its functional units pre-installed.

Inventory capacity interfaces directly with planetary Storage Containers, and the module may be renamed for ease of identification.
release_history: * Endurance - Introduced to the game.
additional_info:
* The player must be near the terminal within a storage unit in order to manually access its contents.
* Storage units are numbered from 0-9 in the Build Menu to correspond with Storage Containers with the same numbers.
* Each number can only be used once within a given freighter. A given storage unit shares its contents with all Storage Container instances with the same number (1 - 1, 2 - 2, and so on).
* Items can be moved from the exosuit, or starship, inventory to storage units while the player is within a freighter build area containing those storage units, or from anywhere with the Matter Beam upgrade installed.
** Items remotely transferred into storage units cannot be directed to a specific unit. Rather, it gets stacked into the first container (in order from 0 to 9) with an open slot. If the container the item would get deposited into already has a stack of that item, it gets stacked.

* Items may be retrieved from a storage unit by
**opening the freighter's inventory menu while the freighter is in the current system, and navigating through each container as if they were additional inventory tabs;
**requesting items to an empty exosuit or starship slot while in the freighter build area, or anywhere else with the Matter Beam upgrade installed in the freighter;
**physically interacting with the unit's terminal and transferring items directly.
*There seems to be a glitch where sometimes you cannot take things out of a certain container, instead showing the description of a technology in the Starship.
** The issue can be circumvented by taking out a different item stack first, allowing the original item stack to be taken but duplicating an item stack in exosuit inventory.

title: Storage Unit
summary: Storage Unit is a base building product that can be found on Derelict Freighters.
game_description: A versatile storage unit, recovered from the wreckage of a derelict freighter.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired by searching salvage crates found inside derelict freighters.
release_history: * Desolation - Added as a base building product.

title: Straight Corridor
summary:
Straight Corridors are a structure designed to connect other larger structures.

They can have windows built on the sides or top.
game_description: A standard straight corridor module for connecting rooms.
release_history:
* Pathfinder - this item was added as a base-building component
* NEXT - recipe updated from 20 Iron to 100 Pure Ferrite
additional_info:
* The blueprint for this can be acquired via the Construction Research Unit
* Power consumption is 1kP

title: Succulent Tree
summary: Bewitching Cactus is an item used in base building.
game_description:
The bark on this tree is misleading. Neither rough nor hard, its flesh is instead soft and moist to the touch. Wrinkles in the surface store extra water for times of hardship.

Provides decorative landscaping opportunities for bases.
additional_info: The blueprint can be purchased from the Quicksilver Synthesis Companion in the Space Anomaly for 500

title: Supply Pipe
summary: Supply Pipe is a base building product that can be used to connect silos and harvesters.
game_description:
Flexible high strength piping. Able to withstand a highly pressurised internal environment.

Used for connecting various Mineral and Silos.
source_info: The blueprint can be obtained from the Construction Research Station aboard the Space Anomaly for 1 Salvaged Data.
release_history: * Beyond - Added as a base building product.
additional_info: The maximum length of a single piece of pipe is 240u. A chain of pipes and Supply Depots can extend this further.

additional_info: When viewing the schematic at the Anomaly's Construction Research Station, the T-Shaped Corridor's subtype will be listed as "AAST."

Advanced nano-mineral coating ensures high performance at depth, without compromising visibility.

title: Teleport Cable
summary:

release_history:
* Beyond - Added as a base building product.
* Endurance - Added to freighter base building.
additional_info: * Electrical Cloaking Units do not hide Teleport Cables.

title: Teleport Chamber
summary: Teleport Chamber is a Freighter Base Building module replacing Base Teleport Module.
game_description:
Vital integrated freighter equipment. This personal teleport device allows the user to move quickly between their freighter, planetary bases, as well as any Space Station Terminuses connected to their network. User is urged to verify network integrity before inserting any matter they cannot afford to become separated from.

This module is placed as an entire room and comes with its functional units pre-installed.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a technology

title: Tentacle Spire
summary: Tentacle Spire is an item used in base building.
game_description:
This delightful architectural floral combines two highly popular aesthetics: wriggling tentacles and giant fungi.

Provides decorative landscaping opportunities for bases.
additional_info: The blueprint can be purchased from the Quicksilver Synthesis Companion in the Space Anomaly for 500

title: Tentacled Decal
summary: Tentacled Decal is a customisation part available from the Scrap Dealer.

An exclusive placeable decal to add a touch of macabre decoration to bases.

This decal depicts a many-armed sentience, found drifting in the dark places of the universe.
release_history:
* Origins - Added as a customisation part.
* Expeditions - blueprint cost, used to be Tainted Metal.

title: Terbium Growth
summary:
Terbium Growth is a exotic planets.

Picking it up gives 1 piece of the product, but it does not unlock its blueprint.

It can be found in the Build Menu under the Decoration/Glitches.
game_description: A rare stabilised glitch, retrieved from a malfunctioning planet. Safe for rehousing in habitable bases.
release_history: * Visions - Added as a product.
additional_info:
Terbium Growth has a blueprint (Pure Ferrite x10), but it is not possible to unlock it through normal gameplay.

However, if the player has one specimen in their inventory, they can build as many in a row as their supply of Pure Ferrite allows.

game_description:

title: Umbrella Tree
summary: Umbrella Tree is an item used in base building.
game_description:
This decorative tree has evolved to cope with high levels of background radiation.  Its central glowing core attracts wildlife and is in no way a sense organ.  It does not watch you.

Provides decorative landscaping opportunities for bases.
additional_info: The blueprint can be purchased from the Quicksilver Synthesis Companion in the Space Anomaly for 500

title: Utopia Research Station
summary: Utopia Research Station is a portable base building product for discovering new blueprints/technology, it can be acquired by completing some patch of the Expedition 9: Utopia.
source_info:
It can be found in the Build Menu under Tech/Portable. Once deployed, it provides access to the following construction research trees (there are 4 types of station):

*Exosuit technology
*Multi-Tool technology
*Starship technology
*Base Construction blueprint

These trees can change depending on the station type. Like Construction Research Station or Construction Research Unit, low-lvl blueprint must be known before you can use high-lvl blueprint.

title: Venom Urchin
summary:
Venom Urchin seeds can be acquired from a hired Farmer, or purchased from the Construction Research Station in the Space Anomaly for 3 Salvaged Data.

The venom sacs in this plant will quickly burn through regular gloves and into a player's skin. One drop of the pungent sap of this plant can leave a player temporarily paralyzed. To avoid this, harvesting requires Haz-Mat Gauntlet.
game_description:
thumb|Venom Urchin grown in a hydroponics tray
A small, innocuous looking plant whose leaves periodically secrete a small amount of potent Sac Venom, a valuable trading commodity.

Suitable for hydroponic indoor planting. Cannot be planted outdoors.

Approximate growing time: 3 hours 20 mins
release_history:
* Foundation - Added as a product.
* Atlas Rises - Renamed from Bloodsbane to Venom Urchin. Blueprint changed, formerly used Thamium9 and Antrium.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Thamium9 and Marrow Bulb.
* Beyond - Blueprint changed, formerly used Emeril and Ionised Cobalt. Growing time fixed in the game description.
additional_info: * Growing the plant will produce 1 Sac Venom in roughly 3 hours 20 minutes of real time.

summary:

Advanced nano-mineral coating ensures high performance at depth, without compromising visibility.
source_info: The blueprint is awarded as part of Dreams of the Deep; however, it can also be unlocked early using a Blueprint Analyser.

title: Wall Switch
summary: Wall Switch is a base building product that is used to toggle power to buildings using Electrical Wiring.
game_description:
A power management device, the switch will toggle the flow of power when pulled.

Switches require both power and signal wires to control a device.
additional_info:
* The blueprint can be acquired from the Construction Research Station on the Space Anomaly for 1 Salvaged Data.
* The product activated in the same way as a Button by a player using it (default E key). The difference is that this one needs to be used by a player one more time to be deactivated, while a Button will deactivate automatically after 1 second of being active.

title: Weapon Rack
summary:
Weapon Rack is a base building product.

​In the Worlds Part II update for No Man's Sky, significant enhancements were made to the Weapon Rack functionality, introducing Multi-tool Archiving:

🛠️ Multi-tool Archiving
Archive Up to 18 Multi-Tools: The buildable Weapon Rack base part now allows players to archive up to 18 Multi-Tools, in addition to the ones they carry.
game_description:
A buildable storage rack for Multi-Tools.

This archive allows for a large expansion to the user's Multi-Tool collection, via a system of long-term storage. Multi-Tools placed in storage are unavailable for immediate use, however they remain available for restoration to the user's active equipment list at a later date.

This module is placed as an entire room and comes with its functional units pre-installed.
